name: Magic Reef Bungalows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in late october 2012. We were picked up very late at night from the airport by the friendly temporary managers Rod and Jo. They were so very nice and helpfull. We woke up in the morning to the sound of the sea in the background against the reef. we were in a cute bungalow at the rear of the property but still had sea peeps and beautiful tropical surroundings. The property was well maintained and had a stunning boat shaped pool that was terrifically icy and refreshing. And the night time visitors of geckos and wee dogs was cute. It is very nice to make a pina colada in the bungalow and make your way down to the deck by the ocean and enjoy a sunset. :) thanks so much for our stay, :)
reviews.title: Great little place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: Truly a gem. Quiet and very well kept. The resort has the pool that is themed in the style of a ship! It is not to be missed, and a great place to cool off. The bungalows also had an outdoor bath and shower which was truly luxurious.
reviews.title: Bathtub in Paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The beach is nice. But bring reef shoes! Many of the beach locations on this side of the island are not ideal swimming locations due to reef and shallow water. However a good pair of reef shoes and. A snorkel make the whole island accessible.
reviews.title: Wedding venue Magic Reef

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff and owner are friendly and truly make you feel welcome. Kudos to the staff!
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Rarotonga

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note because we were "bumped" I don't actually know what the cost was! Thus my value score is a 4 instead of a 5. Assuming the bungalows are well priced its a good bet.
reviews.title: Perfect holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the last five nights of a 15 night Cook Islands holiday at Magic Reef in one of the Absolute Beachfront bungalows, B1, and it was fantastic. It was the most expensive of the three beachfront bungalows we stayed in (one in the south of Rarotonga at the start of the holiday, and another in Aitutaki), and I was pleased that this was the last, as the quality of the bungalow would have spoilt us if we'd stayed there first. I took one look at it and went 'wow!' the room was just so lovely. Every feature seemed to have been well thought out, and I loved the outdoor shower and bath.
reviews.title: Saved the best til last

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only slight negative was a couple of large wooden things at the front of the bungalow (between the plants and the deck) and a large metal pole in the middle of the front of the deck. I personally barely noticed it, but it bugged the hell out of my husband, which in turn annoyed me because he kept saying how much it annoyed him! We never asked what they were, but I'm sure they were there for a reason.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I had forgotten that there was a continental style breakfast provided on the first morning of our stay, so it was a lovely surprise to see the bread, jam, cereal, juice and fruit waiting for us in the fridge when we arrived.
reviews.title: Fabulous place to unwind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: Grace was very friendly and helpful, and as was Thomas, who I understand is from the Pacific Resort and is managing Magic Reef in the interim period while it is apparently up for sale (due to the sad death of the previous owner).
reviews.title: Private, convenient and pretty place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was good, on the west side of the island, which meant lots of lovely sunsets.
reviews.title: Cosy bungalows on the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we were met at the airport until we left, the staff, particularly Grace were very helpful and friendly. The bungalows were very clean and tidy. Great outdoor bathroom, with nice big shower head. Very comfy large size comfy bed. Good swimming pool in the shape of a boat.Nice area nearly on the beach to have lunch or the the 5 o'clock drinkies. Right next door to the Waterline Restaurant. Nice cocktails, but food average.
reviews.title: Magic experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant to go to is the Kikau Hut. The owner (Kevin) transports you to and from the restaurant. Food and service is excellent...went there twice for dinner.
reviews.title: Magic place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend this as a place to stay. Staff very friendly and helpful and nothing was to much trouble.Bungalows are very attractive and loved the outside bath. Very quite location and although not the best swimming in the lagoon a few minutes to other fabulous swimming spots and for those who don't like the ocean they have a lovely swimming pool.
reviews.title: Ten Out Of Ten

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rarotonga has a lot of accommodation to choose from and if you have not stayed before it is difficult to pick from the choice. However being our second visit we had a good idea what we were looking for and Magic Reef was it.
reviews.title: Small but beautiful and perfectly formed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: Very quite, peaceful tranquil location.
reviews.title: Great value and peaceful bungalows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We booked our holiday at Magic Reef because our daughter had arranged for her marriage to take place there. Magic doesn't describe the location – I would call it superb!
reviews.title: Not just magic but superb.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wedding setting was in the gazebo on the beach front and the staff paid every attention to detail in decorating the location and serving the canapés and drinks. The gardener even raked the beach to remove debris and smooth the sand. The whole event ran like clockwork and everyone had a really enjoyable time.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bungalows themselves were well appointed and the garden was well laid out, with each bungalow enjoying a degree of privacy as they were angled toward the beach.
reviews.title: Beautifully Romantic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only downside was the rather poorly lit bathroom and the lack of a full-length mirror, but that is the only criticism.
reviews.title: Paradise found!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is child-free and consequently very quiet – apart from the roosters in adjoining properties, who took it upon themselves to start crowing at any time of night.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Peaceful

description: The newly built 8 Polynesian style self-contained bungalows are located right on the beach of Arorangi, with golden sunset views from each bungalow. All bungalows have sea views, romantic four poster kingsize beds, private outdoor shower/bath, a/c and ceiling fan, home entertainment. The boat-shaped pool with a unique sail, BBQ facilities and a Petanque course invite to relax. Complimentary airport transfers and breakfast on arrival.
